summary: john peacock has named his england squad for next month's european under-17 championship in bulgaria . the young lions are the defending champions, having beaten holland on penalties in the final last year . they have been placed in group d alongside holland, italy and the republic of ireland this time around and will open their campaign against italy on may 7 .

aspect: 1. England's U17 squad named by coach John Peacock for the UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria.
2. The Young Lions, defending champions, will face Italy, Holland, and the Republic of Ireland in Group D.
3. The squad includes players from various Premier League clubs, with Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo representing Chelsea and Arsenal's Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi.
explain: John Peacock has announced England's U17 squad for the upcoming European Championship in Bulgaria. They are the defending champions and will open their campaign against Italy on May 7.

The England national under-17 football team, also known as The Young Lions, who are the current defending champions, will be competing in the upcoming European championship in Bulgaria. They are grouped with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland in Group D, with their first match being against Italy on May 7th.

The aspect highlights the inclusion of players from various Premier League clubs in the England squad for the European Under-17 Championship, with notable representatives from Chelsea and Arsenal, such as Jay Dasilva and Chris Willock.
